cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 207 (Friday, December 15, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. THANEDAR:H.R. 6845.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Section 8 Article I of the ConstitutionThe single subject of this legislation is:To require officials of the Department of Defense toprovide a briefing on the implementation of categorymanagement memorandum, and for other purposes[Page H6993]

item.title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

cdata.text:
Equitable Contracting and Small Business Advancement Act

This bill requires the Office of the Under Secretary of Defense for Acquisition and Sustainment and the Office of Small Business Programs of the Department of Defense to annually provide a joint briefing to Congress on the implementation of the memorandum titled Achieving Small Business Goals through Category Management Practices (January 27, 2023). Among other elements, the briefing must describe the effects of the memorandum on contracting opportunities for small businesses.

bill.title: Equitable Contracting and Small Business Advancement Act

item.title: Equitable Contracting and Small Business Advancement Act
Equitable Contracting and Small Business Advancement Act
To require officials of the Department of Defense to provide a briefing on the implementation of category management memorandum, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
